results.abstract: US NASA officials rept on Aug 31 that Apollo 15 astronaut Lt Col Worden has been transferred out of astronaut corps to Ames Research Center, where he will be research engineer and test pilot; changes affecting Apollo 15 astronauts Cols Scott and Irwin since crew was reprimanded for stamp smuggling incident revd

headline.main: Worden Is Transferred From Astronaut Office

results.snippet: HOUSTON, Aug. 31 (AP) -- Lieut. Col. Alfred M. Worden, one of the three spacemen involved in the Apollo 15 stamp-cover dispute, has been transferred out of the astronaut office, officials said today.
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Aug. 31 (AP) -- Lieut. Col. Alfred M. Worden, one of the three spacemen involved in the Apollo 15 stamp-cover dispute, has been transferred out of the astronaut office, officials said today.

results.abstract: 'Possible Dream Auction', sponsored by Standard Oil Co (NJ) in cooperation with Arts & Business Council of NY Trade Bd to promote community arts in city, will auction off such unusual items as use of vacation homes in fall '73; auction is expected to raise more than $250,000; Standard Oil mgr T H Tonnessen announces on Sept 7 $40,000 grant to administer auction project, meeting of more than 100 leaders of NY's cutural and civic groups

headline.main: ' Possible Dream Auction' Planned to Help the Arts

results.snippet: Opportunities to conduct a major symphony orchestra, partake of a Chinese dinner prepared by Danny Kaye and lunch with Neil Armstrong, the astronaut, are among the enticements promised in "The Possible Dream Auction," a new project to promote...
results.lead_paragraph: Opportunities to conduct a major symphony orchestra, partake of a Chinese dinner prepared by Danny Kaye and lunch with Neil Armstrong, the astronaut, are among the enticements promised in "The Possible Dream Auction," a new project to promote community arts in the city.

results.abstract: Black Panther newspaper published in Oakland, Calif, commenting on A Davis's tour of USSR, says she has deserted black people under dictates of Amer Communist party
results.snippet: Alf M. Landon, the Republican candidate for President in 1936, celebrates his 85th birthday today at his home in Topeka, Kan. Asked in a prebirthday interview if he thought Senator George McGovern would replace him as the candidate who made the worst...
results.lead_paragraph: Alf M. Landon, the Republican candidate for President in 1936, celebrates his 85th birthday today at his home in Topeka, Kan. Asked in a prebirthday interview if he thought Senator George McGovern would replace him as the candidate who made the worst showing in a Presidential election, Mr. Landon laughed and said, "I wouldn't predict anything like that.

headline.main: NASA Says 15 Astronauts Signed Stamps for Sale; NASA Says 15 Astronauts Were Paid $37,500 for Autographing Stamps and Postcards

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 -The value of the commercial exploitation of the Apollo program passed $1-million today with the announcement by the space agency that 15 astronauts had been paid $37,500 for signing more than 30,000 stamps and postcards.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 -The value of the commercial exploitation of the Apollo program passed $1-million today with the announcement by the space agency that 15 astronauts had been paid $37,500 for signing more than 30,000 stamps and postcards.

results.abstract: US NASA releases 11-page 'Summary of Apollo 15 Commercialization Incidents' on Sept 15, totaling value of commercial exploitation of Apollo program in sale of stamp covers, watches, medals and figurines at $1,006,829; rept concludes that 15 unidentified astronauts, 9 of whom are still at NASA, were paid total of $37,800 (about $2,500 each) for signing more than 30,000 stamp covers and postcards sold in US and abroad; 5 astronauts contributed their shares to charity; Justice Dept is reviewing exploitation to determine whether Fed violations exist that would warrant Govt action, and has asked NASA to issue no further statements on matter until rev is completed; NASA Asst Admr Donnelly explains how stamps covers were signed; marketing of stamps through H W Eiermann and H E Sieger revd, with their gains estimated at $272,-250; Admr Fletcher announces that it will now be NASA policy to 'drastically limit and restrict' items carried by astronauts on future flights

headline.main: NASA Says 15 Astronauts Signed Stamps for Sale; NASA Says 15 Astronauts Were Paid $37,500 for Autographing Stamps and Postcards

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 -The value of the commercial exploitation of the Apollo program passed $1-million today with the announcement by the space agency that 15 astronauts had been paid $37,500 for signing more than 30,000 stamps and postcards.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 -The value of the commercial exploitation of the Apollo program passed $1-million today with the announcement by the space agency that 15 astronauts had been paid $37,500 for signing more than 30,000 stamps and postcards.

results.abstract: Brevard Printing Co mgr J H Jacobs says on Sept 18 that envelopes taken to moon aboard Apollo 15 and later sold to stamp dealers were ordered by NASA official H G Collins and billed to former Hughes Enterprises employe A H Bishop; Hughes's public relations spokesman R Hannah indicates that Bishop did not work for Hughes at time of incident; printing of 1,000-1,200 envelopes cost about $200; Collins declines to comment until current Justice Dept investigation of stamp smuggling incident is completed

headline.main: Apollo 15 Stamps Sale Linked To NASA and Ex-Hughes Aides

results.snippet: COCOA, Fla., Sept. 18 (AP) -The manager of a printing company said today that the envelopes carried to the moon aboard Apollo 15 and later sold to stamp dealers had been ordered by a NASA official and billed to a businessman who then worked for the...
results.lead_paragraph: COCOA, Fla., Sept. 18 (AP) -The manager of a printing company said today that the envelopes carried to the moon aboard Apollo 15 and later sold to stamp dealers had been ordered by a NASA official and billed to a businessman who then worked for the Hughes Enterprises.

results.abstract: J J O'Connor revs Banacek TV series, which is part of rotating trilogy presented under name of NBC Wednesday Mystery Movie

headline.main: TV: N.B.C. Presents Two New Series of Triple-Play Routine; Mystery Movie' Uses Adventure Format O'Brian Plays 'Search' Lead as Investigator

results.snippet: " This Fall," proclaim the ads, "N.B.C. week has it all." Well, let's not look at that one too closely. But Wednesday evenings the National Broadcasting Company certainly comes close to having all the policeman - detective - private eye action in...
results.lead_paragraph: " This Fall," proclaim the ads, "N.B.C. week has it all." Well, let's not look at that one too closely. But Wednesday evenings the National Broadcasting Company certainly comes close to having all the policeman - detective - private eye action in television town.

headline.main: Wood, Field and Stream: One-Shot Hunters Zero In

results.snippet: LANDER, Wyo. -- Recently, a trio of Eastern outdoor writer-editors came here determined to demonstrate to their Western hosts that excellent markmanship is not confined to the men of Marlboro Country.

byline.original: By NELSON BRYANTSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LANDER, Wyo. -- Recently, a trio of Eastern outdoor writer-editors came here determined to demonstrate to their Western hosts that excellent markmanship is not confined to the men of Marlboro Country.
